title: Flying the Flag of the United States at Full- Staff on Inauguration Day
summary: The document is a proclamation by the President of the United States, issued on January 20, 2025, declaring that the flag of the United States shall be flown at full-staff on Inauguration Day to honor the significance of the event and the nation. This order applies to all public buildings, military posts, and U.S. embassies both domestically and abroad for the duration of Inauguration Day. Following this day, the flag will be returned to half-staff in memory of former President James Earl Carter, Jr., as previously directed in an earlier proclamation, until 30 days after his death. This proclamation reflects a commitment to honoring national traditions while also acknowledging the loss of a former leader.
